result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin R Kovach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI) monitoring fees.  $500.00 paid from cash bond posted; balance of $1,287.00 remains due and owing.
Complete high school education and obtain diploma, HSED or GED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.   Not to enter bars, liquor stores or other establishments whose primary business is the sale of alcohol.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervisiion and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, to include cognitive thinking.  Follow through with recommendations.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R Kovach

Defendant Justin R Kovach in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the GPS monitor be removed.
St- Objects to the GPS being removed.
BTC: Bond modification granted. GPS to be removed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  
** AMENDED 8-12-2015:  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions would be going to court, meeting with atty, and going to work. **
AMENDED 2/23/16:  DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND AA AND/OR NA MEETINGS.  DEFENDANT MAY ENGAGE IN TREATMENT.  DEFENDANT MAY MEET WITH A COUNSELOR AT GATEWAY TO PREPARE TO START SCHOOL AT THE NEXT SEMESTER.

**AMENDED 3-22-2016:  Defendant is allowed to attend Gateway.**

**AMENDED 6-6-2016: GPS MONITOR TO BE REMOVED.**
